abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Phase of the
            Community Action Program Grant Project (PAC2) for Niger is
            to improve rural communes' capacity to design and
            implement in a participatory manner Communal Development
            Plans (CDP) and Annual Investment Plans (AIP) and therefore
            contributing to enhance rural livelihoods. The project
            constitutes the second phase of the Community Action Program
            (a 12 year APL). The country's political and
            institutional context is challenging. Implementation of the
            Project is on track but could experience difficulties if an
            adjustment is not made to the disbursement scheme so that
            the underestimated cost of selected activities is
            appropriately corrected. The initial estimation for
            operating costs was based on the PAC1 coverage of 54
            communes instead of the actual 164 communes covered by the
            PAC2. Overall, changes are minor.
